keyword: how many calories in sliced bread
title: How Many Calories in Sliced Bread?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in sliced bread per slice, including carbs, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for easy tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in Sliced Bread?
assumptions: Standard white sliced bread, one medium slice (~28 g), untoasted, no added spreads.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, type (white/whole grain), slice thickness, and ingredients; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One slice of sliced bread contains about 80 kcal and 15 g of carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of sliced bread?
faqs.a: Approximately 80 kcal for a standard medium slice of white bread.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in sliced bread?
faqs.a: About 15 g of carbs per slice, mostly from refined flour in white varieties.

faqs.q: Does whole grain sliced bread have fewer calories?
faqs.a: Similar calories (~75 kcal per slice) but more fiber (around 2 g) than white bread.

faqs.q: How does toasting affect calories in sliced bread?
faqs.a: Toasting doesn't change calories significantly; it mainly affects texture and moisture.

faqs.q: What about sodium in sliced bread?
faqs.a: Around 150 mg per slice; varies by brand and if it's a low-sodium option.
